comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SBF_Helldiver ?possible candidates ; one source indicates they operated from the USS Valley Forge until 1949...my father was a WW2 Kittyhawk pilot...I grew up looking at pics of Kittyhawks, which is about where my aeronautical expertise begins and ends...the tail section on these planes looks to have come out of the same Curtiss mould, which is why they gained my attention...if I'm on the right track, someone who actually knows what they're talking about will be able to tell us whether these are SB2C-4's or 5's...the 4's were evidently rigged to carry rockets under the wings (which is what I gather we see here) and I'd assume the 5's would have been as well...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Snap! (well almost!) - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/18059458 So it must have been Friday 30 January 1948.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I have no idea about the planes, but the RAAF bombed the VALLEY FORGE the following week - Read All About It - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/49644119 . Mention of Mustangs in the article, but they might have been Australian.
